about_the_game:
Explore an abandoned research facility that has a monster lurking around with your only method of defense being a gun that can teleport the monster to a random location. Play through 3 sagas with different environments and goals, the third even allowing you to change the direction of gravity.



15 years ago, Donovan Innovations was the pinnacle of scientific development. However, one day, everyone inside didn't leave the building. Ever since, anyone that went inside never came back. Rumor has it there is something inside that kills anyone unfortunate enough to encounter it. This has left the research facility in a ruined state, yet still somehow operational? And what were they working on inside?

Saga 1: Into The Maze

Prove to your friends that you are not scared and enter the maze in the back of the facility to find 2 red rocks. Be on the lookout for anything undesireable and use your Randomization IsoLocator to teleport it away. Be careful not to draw too much attention to yourself and keep a close eye on your ammo.

Saga 2: Extended Innovations

A close relative has entered the facility and has not managed to come back. Stubborn as you are, you enter the facility in the hopes of finding them. Unlock new areas of the facility using various codes that are lying around and use the features of the Randomization IsoLocator to forge a path towards the CEO's office. Oh, and make sure not to die to the dangers of the facility or to the monster stalking you.

Saga 3: Gravity Gauntlet

Lastly, experience a time where the facility was still in use. Follow the story of Greg, an employee who has been given the privilege to test out the new GravBlaster, a gun that can change the direction of gravity inside of a room. Solve gravity based challenges to impress your boss and try not to die during the test. What could possibly go wrong?

short_description: Telescape is a horror / puzzle game consisting of multiple sagas that each have a different goal and add extra mechanics. Find items, solve puzzles and change the direction of gravity while teleporting a monster to a random location as your only means of defense.
